info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 22 at 2:47PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Luzerne County through 330 PM EDT... At 247 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Shickshinny, or 8 miles northeast of Berwick, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Wilkes-Barre, Hazleton, Muhlenberg, Berwick, Nanticoke, Plymouth, West Hazleton, Freeland, Ashley and Dorrance. This includes the following highway exits... Interstate 80 between 256 and 262. Pennsylvania Interstate 81 between 151A and B and 165. Interstate 476 near 105. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
